metadata.how_to_trigger: recruit Galeoe qnight NIGHT_Ceremorphosis2_485f589f-0da1-4eea-9a28-210f91837a69Go to camp, cinematic auto triggers upon arrival

6.speaker: Gale
6.text: Be with you in a moment!

72.speaker: Gale
72.text: Indulging in a spot of vanity. Handsome devil, aren't I?

71.speaker: Gale
71.text: Not a trick, my friend. Magic!

10.speaker: Player
10.text: All that wizardry makes me uncomfortable.

27.speaker: Gale
27.text: Whatever for? Look at him! Never too much of a good thing, I say.

3.speaker: Gale
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Duped and mirrored Perfromance Data - (He dispels the double with a flourish.)

30.speaker: Gale
30.text: Ceremorphosis. What does it make you think of?

17.speaker: Player
17.text: First and foremost: that damn tadpole.

66.speaker: Gale
66.text: Day one: fever and memory loss.

19.speaker: Gale
19.text: Day two: hallucinations and greying skin.

53.speaker: Gale
53.text: Day three: hair loss and blood leaking from all orifices.

14.speaker: Gale
14.text: Day four: excruciating pain as the skeleton and organs reform and reposition.

73.speaker: Gale
73.text: Day five: the host's personality has disappeared. Fingers, toes and limbs elongate.

15.speaker: Gale
15.text: I take it you get the picture?

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I do, but you might as well finish the picture.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I do, but I'd like to see if you get the rest right.

39.speaker: Gale
39.text: Day six: the flesh around the mouth splits to make way for tentacles.

0.speaker: Gale
0.text: Day seven: a mind flayer is born.

79.speaker: Gale
79.text: This is the abridged version of course.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: A very vivid picture. And very upsetting.

57.speaker: Gale
57.text: My point is this: our orifices remain blissfully unbloodied. Our heads remain clear, and our blood temperature normal.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: This version was more than vivid enough for my tastes.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: We should be having a fever by now. Greying skin even.

29.speaker: Gale
29.text: Our orifices remain blissfully unbloodied. Our heads remain clear, and our blood temperature normal.

24.speaker: Gale
24.text: Any expert will agree: this is... abnormal.

42.speaker: Gale
42.text: The pragmatic in me, however, sees only the silence before the storm.

68.speaker: Gale
68.text: Something to sleep on. We should get some rest.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Can you explain why the symptoms aren't showing?

75.speaker: Gale
75.text: That, alas, is where my knowledge fails me.

7.speaker: Gale
7.text: A rogue might call it luck; a priest might call it fate.

37.speaker: Gale
37.text: As for myself: I'm a pragmatic. I see the silence before the storm.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: And what makes you the expert?

25.speaker: Gale
25.text: But what is happening, or rather not happening to us, is entirely undocumented.

63.speaker: Gale
63.text: Uncharted territory. The silence before the storm.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Agreed. This is not the version I learned by heart.

58.speaker: Gale
58.text: What is happening, or rather not happening to us, is entirely undocumented.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Dragon blood is hardy stuff. I'm not surprised I'm immune.

80.speaker: Gale
80.text: Yes, but that doesn't quite explain little old me, now does it?

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Just wrap this up, will you?

76.speaker: Gale
76.text: A faultless if abridged version of the facts.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Shake your head. You know this routine all too well.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Until quite recently, nothing at all.

62.speaker: Gale
62.text: Ah, yes. The good old days.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: If you're about to start a lecture, I'm not interested.

35.speaker: Gale
35.text: Thanks to the tadpole, we should have developed more than invasive symptoms by now, but we haven't.

64.speaker: Gale
64.text: Not the prettiest of transmutations, is it?

40.speaker: Gale
40.text: I saw Lae'zel giving you a look-over. Great minds think alike.

51.speaker: Gale
51.text: No doubt she came to the same conclusion: we're healthier than we should be.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Why are you studying your own mirror image?

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Typical. A wizard using magic just to admire his own beard.

81.speaker: Gale
81.text: A gentleman's only as dashing as his least groomed locus.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Make it dance. Oh, or breathe fire!

48.speaker: Gale
48.text: It's done all that and more at plenty a soirée, I can tell you.
